page.title: 13Architecture in Sth Benfleet
page.content: House styles recall the development of Benfleet,but the replacing of old windows and doors with double_glazing is making the dating of domestic architecture difficult. Many houses still hold clues:Tall houses with long,vertical sash windows point to the development at the turn of the century.The detached small wooden holiday bungalows in large gardens were built in the Twenties.The Thirties brought all_electric brick_ built bungalows and houses with horizontal Crittal windows and sunray motifs, with a few avant_garde houses with flat roofs.This style was continued after the war with cavity walls a new feature.Mock Georgian was the style of the Seventies and has now been replaced by a vernicular Arts and Craft style,influenced by the Essex Design Council.
